intro: Argentina glabriuscula var. oligandra, commonly known as the Argentine spider flower, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial native to South America, particularly Argentina. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale pink petals. It has hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
